intro: Pavetta tenuiflora, commonly known as slender-flowered pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical in shape. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The plant's botanical characteristics make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
